solution.text:
Let the cost of the cricket bat be denoted by the variable p
Let the cost of the hockey stick be denoted by the variable q
The question tells us that the cost of the bat is _{k}_ times more than the cost of the hockey stick.
Therefore, we can infer that p is _{k}_ times greater than q. Or, in other words : p = _{k}_ q

content.text: The cost of a cricket bat is _{k}_ times the cost of a hockey stick. (Assume the cost of the bat to be p and the cost of the hockey stick to be q)
